lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. And get the somewhat adjusted, altered countdown to us going live.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: False start, offense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's great. But yes, welcome. We have just a couple of announcements to do tonight. Nothing too long and crazy. First and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mine's really long, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Sam's is really long. Speaking of which, let's go ahead and get us into our wonderful sponsor for tonight, Loot Crate.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Loot Crate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much, Loot Crate. Sam, if you want to tell us a little about Loot Crate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But tonight I've prepared, because we all need just some theater today. I've prepared for us a small radio play.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'd like each of you to read a part in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pass 'em down, pass 'em down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pass it down, keep passing it down. I didn't know Ashley was going to be here, so, Ashley, you can read with Travis. You are both--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sam!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are both doing it together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The first line--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, calm down. It's sort of a Dust Bowl type of a play I wrote.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sam!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wrote a play, okay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have to say this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Travis and Laura are-- Travis and Ashley are the radio sound effects duo. Let's see how this goes. August, 1929, the Badlands, South Dakota. Lights up on the McCallister Farm. Mama, a sturdy, country woman, comes in from the windy, dusty farm and slams the door. Sound effects!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (wind noises)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (ke-thunk)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Junior? Junior! Git yer slowpoke, molasses ass down here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! That's me! Enter Junior, a simpleton, down the stairs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (ke-kunk, ke-kunk, ke-kunk, ke-kunk)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good sound effects, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Sorry I didn't do no chores, Mama. I'm a simpleton!" What are you doing to me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "You'll be sorry when I run this cat-o-nine tails over your rear end."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (whip sound)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, good sound effect, good sound effect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "It ain't my fault because school was late because Teacher Sally died the evening before last."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on! Project,

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "It ain't my fault school was late because, well, Teacher Sally died this "evening before last."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Not sweet, sweet Sally. My rear end, I'm going to miss her. What did her in?" I don't even know what the fuck--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Enter Pa, a drunk. He smashes a beer bottle against the family cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (thumps)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you're not the sound effects.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (glass shattering)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (cat snarling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Oh, same thing that kills us all around here. Dust poisoning. As we all know the Dust "Bowl's full of radioactive dust. It melts your face clean off of the bone."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "It's true. And dust ebola is the second leading cause of death in the dust bowl. My rear "end just can't stand this dusty dust. Deadly dust."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Junior.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Here, Ma, I found your bagpipes to play at the dust funeral."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (awful yet great impression of bagpipes) (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good sound effects!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Oh, Lord, what will we ever do with this dust?!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Enter Sam Riegel, a strapping traveling salesman from the big city, played by Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Hi, folks! Handsome Sam Riegel here. Only thing more handsome than me is this here Loot "Crate, featuring X-X-X."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Once you enjoy the geeky gear inside, you can use the box to clean up, well, all this dust!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Can it be? A box than can cure our woes and pick us up back onto our dusty rear ends?" What's with-- why?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Hooray!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And so the McCallisters used a dusty old vacuum cleaner--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (vacuum noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit. It keeps getting better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a playwright, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A few on the fly rewrites there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Far better than most playwrights.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, well done, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good sound effects, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that was good sound effects.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Well. Next up, we have a quick announcement that a special guest is going to come in here and tag me out. We have Brian Foster. Go ahead and tag. Boom! (cheering)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hello, hello, hello. Man, it's been a Chris Hardweek, hasn't it?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We're going to talk about the previous week's episode. We're going to give away prizes every single week. We're also going to have the near-impossible task of picking out your fanart and gifs-- I said "gifs" because "jif" sounds so mushy. It's "gif", right? Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, living language; we decide.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We're going to give out, it says here, a shirtless picture of Travis Willingham riding a mechanical bull.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The photoshoot is still TBD.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, I see. Yes. (singing) He's waiting for an open tanning bed. Because we get so many-- there's so many thousands of tweets every Thursday night that go out about this amazing and weird and horrible show, we are asking that if you guys want to tweet a question for us to ask the cast live on the air, we're asking that you tweet @TalksMachina, which is the official Twitter handle for our show. And use the hashtag #AskTalksMachina because that way we can track 'em, make sure we get as many of your questions as we can on the show. Send your fanart and gifs to talksmachina@gmail.com anytime between Thursday nights during the show and Tuesdays at 9:00am Pacific Time. We're trying to feature fanart and gifs from each week's episodes since we're going to be talking about those episodes on the show on Tuesdays. So send those in. That's it. We're going to see you guys this Tuesday at 7:00pm on Twitch and Pro-ject Alpha dot com. Until then, it's high noon! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fix your mic there, Matt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Look at the jaw, it's so forced.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Motherfucker. Didn't get enough of that at BlizzCon this past weekend. Okay, then. (laughs) Thank you, Brian Foster.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That guy's hot! Is he single?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's taken, unfortunately.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By you? All right, so, anyway we have one more quick announcement, Liam, if you want to take over for this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well it's not really an announcement, I'm just a willing accomplice with one of my favorite artist buddies. Sedona Parnham has sent something she has made specifically for Sam Riegel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, me? Oh. Why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it was sent to me on the sly, because you're so dear. To all of us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a radio play?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So dear. So charming. And now you will be well-rested. Please accept this gift.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm so excited.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this? Do I read it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, don't read-- it's nothing to read. Just open it up and show us all what you find.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, my-- (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a pillow case. It's a pillow case.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's size appropriate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The chest hair, the nipples. It's adorable, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so cute!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gross. Gross.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to be sleeping on the same pillows at night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, we need a blanket as well.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Somewhere out there, (simultaneous) someone's saying a prayer! (simultaneous) if love will see us through!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're in different parts of the song.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For all you Critters who are under the age of 35, you have know idea what we're singing. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go watch American Tail and Land Before Time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So that was from Sedona who is known as @anodesu on Twitter. She's done a ton of great art for this show. She's one of my favorites; she's a buddy now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's my favorite now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, we are to find our way to the first giant you requested. This was the one named Whaska. Is that correct?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Whaska. (louder) Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let us find our way to the Zenith Forge where he does most of his work."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Forge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Zenith Forge. Now come. Follow me." And he tugs the chains with a sudden burst and pulls you along. As you begin walking, he begins to talk about how: "Whaska is one of the few giants that "still maintains the privilege of freedom. There was a coup within their people a few years ago, "seemingly orchestrated by some of their own. As such most of the fire giants in the city "either were cast out or were placed in chains. And the few that remain, one of which you'll speak "with on this day, is one of the ones that sold them out. So. I hope you have your questions ready."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, for you? Shitloads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shh."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't talk to your master in public.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we have a safety word?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Oklahoma.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're led through a multitude of streets, led along the outside of this large place that he points out to you that he refers to as the furnace. "That is where the Charcoal Palace exists "and the sultan of the entire city. We won't be going there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Chuckle Palace?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Chocolate Palace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Charcoal Palace. You are listening; you are not supposed to speak."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like charcoal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Charcoal Palace." The air itself here, as you're spending more time outside-- and the interior of these buildings aren't meant to detract heat or cool either. Most if not all of the denizens here are well-tempered against the heat. As you guys are being dragged along, I need all of you who do not have fire resistance to go ahead and make another constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm a master of a good burn. Does that give me fire resistance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope! So I think that you don't have to worry about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I had cast fire resistance on me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and how long does that last?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It lasts an hour. Has it been an hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been about an hour now, so that's past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll recast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do a reroll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a saving throw, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A saving throw, yes. Constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I allowed to inspire myself on a saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Only on ability checks, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vex?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven. I burn to death.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, you take a point of exhaustion.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just feeling so tired.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you are currently at disadvantage on ability checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The heat makes you lethargic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm very familiar with that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis can work you through the exhaustion levels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heading past the buildings and constructs you see these spires that come into these rounded point towers all made from some colored glass, some dark greens and blacks. You begin to see there are deep, carved, and well-manufactured waterways or what would be considered waterways in other cities. Except here, the actual molten lava from the Sea of Fire pours through. So there are large bridges that lead over these constantly bubbling and churning long aqueducts that are filled with molten rock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the ground or raised or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the ground. Similar to how you see most city aqueducts constructed, except for the Sea of Fire spills into it. Anything going over there is uncomfortable as the heat grows astronomically as you pass over each bridge and the air itself becomes more sulfurous. And you find yourselves coughing autonomically as the fumes reach your lungs. You begin to pass by--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're walking out in public at this point, right? And there's people about? We see other beings about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some coasting at different levels of height, some just traversing through. Occasionally you come across strange, horned devil-like entities that work, walk in clusters.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, question, because I put on the Ring of Invisibility before we left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But Senokir, I think, might have chuckled when I gave my sister a wet willie. So as we're walking, and I've got the ring on, as we pass people I'm doing this and looking to see if anyone is reacting to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one else reacts except for Senokir. Who looks back towards you with this-- (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, God, that face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can hear you moving around me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (fart noise)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Blends in with the sulfur; I don't care.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Being led through the street you eventually see two large, lithe gray-fleshed creatures that stalk by with these large hooked tails that bend over in front. You can see barbs sticking out of parts of their body and they move in clusters of three or four.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, were they walking on two feet or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two feet. They're bipedal. And they're stalking through--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With like big-ass scorpion tails?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you do see the occasional human, the occasional elf, not being subjugated, though they do usually carry some sort of a bodyguard or a handful of servants at their side as well. But you do see devils walking amongst the people here. And many, many efreet that are all walking the streets with large scimitars at their side and with a uniform, a long silk vest of a dull grey charcoal pattern. And it looks to be a pendant that hangs around their neck that constantly churns with a flame. And it's a uniform for each of these, and you get the sense as they walk around singularly or in pairs, that these probably act as the patrol, as the guard of the city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those that are walkin' around that don't like have a bodyguard and don't seem to be enslaved, are they still wearing that white and gold cloak-y thing that our strange bit is wearing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. They are very diverse in their attire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that at least the outfits they're wearing is their signature outfit. But you also have a hard time grasping what the cultural intricacies are of the City of Brass. Being that you're Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're passing by these various aspects-- do you have a question?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I just wanted to whisper: Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (coughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you pick these locks as we're walking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (softly) Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it then. Subtly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will stealthily pick my sister's locks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys are walking past, and at this point Senokir is talking and he mentions off to the side, "We are now passing the street of artisans and the city market. This is what we call "the Pyraklum. This is where we're going to find Whaska. This is where we're going to find the "Zenith Forge and hopefully the end of your journey. But we can work out the specifics later." As this is happening, I need you to make a sleight of hand roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get behind Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Sleight of hand roll, boy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm going to Luck that sucker.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, God.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It doesn't matter, it doesn't matter. It's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a lockpicking check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Okay, that's fine as well. That's 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However as time goes on you eventually (click) hear the gentle release of the lock on one of her arm manacles and then slowly the other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As I trail backwards behind her you hear: twins, motherfucker! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to approach a large black and gray building built from heavy, heavy stones--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I talk to Uten a little bit while we're walking?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is she picking your nose?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought the same thing! It's a scratch, no pick!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, do you play tour guide often to newcomers in this town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Uten says, "It is not often that we take newcomers under our wing like this. Usually they "are either customers or, well, to be arrested shortly. So, no, this is probably the first tour "we've given. Senokir seems to strangely enjoy it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Playing tour guide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Apparently!" Motions over and Senokir, other hand out, is like, "And around this way, you "can see the Fenstral Spire, which is a wonderful craft fair that happens once every two weeks!" Uten goes back to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's making shit up as he's walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems he has quite a love for the City of Brass. How long have you all been residents here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've been in business together for about the better part of ten years. I've only been here "about 12. It was a very dangerous scavenge to begin, but at least the laws of the normal world "do not apply here. I have no idea how long Senokir's been here. He keeps a lot to himself, "that one, but I trust him."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And your business mainly deals in--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fine jewelry. I showed you our establishment."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, as you mentioned, people ending in arrest, are you bounty hunters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! I must admit, our life is not as interesting as you might be expecting, and I am "sorry for that. I will say, probably should not be talking so much right now."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Go, slaves! Walk! Forward! Like you do!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you talking to us like that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because-- shut up, slave! And I smack Grog with the flail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't physically hurt, but emotionally, there's a scar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm wounded! I've been gashed open!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Forward march! (whip crack)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, he didn't say Oklahoma.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You never said Oklahoma.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pulp Fiction!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue pushing forward, eventually you come to that gray building with heavy gray and dark stones. It's large, square in shape, and you see an oversized chimney that bellows out constant black smoke that pours upward into infinity. There are a number of stacks like that throughout the entirety of the city, hundreds that all eventually bleed together as they all mingle and join in the atmosphere, whatever this atmosphere is consisting of. The large doors are partially open, they're about 20 feet tall and about 20 feet as wide as well. They are made from a very dark wood, but as you get close, it's just a textured stone. You see a dull light from the inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we, Master?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Welcome to the Zenith Forge. So, once we enter, I would have to be the one to ask all the "questions, but that would be difficult for us to do. So the choice is yours. Either we try and find "a careful way to funnel questions, or we put our cards on the table and you do the talking."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can alter myself to look like you, if you can hang back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You already look like Uten and other compatriots. You can still speak, I just want to make "sure that, well, our slaves don't talk out of turn."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you spoken with a fire giant before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been a while. Since the upset socially, I found it best to not deal with them "outside of a customer-patron relationship."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So weird. Are they good conversationalists?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're curious."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're sweet, little one."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're very big."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And consider that since they kept their freedom, they're probably rather cunning."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Bigger than him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You'll see."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he begins to tug the chains and pull you through the doorway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit. What questions are we asking?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we have to ask, like, hey do you have any cool collections? Do you play cards? Have you won a lot? Stuff like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. What's going to make him give us this thing anyway? Do we have anything to give him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, aren't we going to try and steal it once we see it? Or are we really going to try and purchase it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe he's got beef with somebody in the city and we'll go out and jack 'em up if he'll tell us where--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or maybe if we see that he has it then we can challenge him to a game of cards?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or maybe-- oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we see that he has it. How do we know that he has it?

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he might not have it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could also chat with him and I could walk over and take it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well maybe he won't know its value.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a suit of armor, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That he can't fit into because he's huge and it's for normal people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You still have your Locate Item, correct?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do! Oh yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Use it. Now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay! I use it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to stop as you're being pulled into the foyer of this building in chains, and you're going to begin to cast the spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, do I have to stop? I can't do it as we're walking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean you can do it, it's a visual thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can hold him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Senokir, hold?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One moment!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Senokir?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, a little bit of preparation on our end, if you don't mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Then decide. I mean, if you wish to progress--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you continue the ritual. All right. You concentrate for a second as he's talking, and currently no. You do not sense it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And that lasts for ten minutes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it can point us in the right direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lasts for up to ten minutes, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it 1000 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1000 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Radius.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Senokir, how large is the forge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, here it's a few rooms. It's large enough to house Whaska and his servants to "construct the crafts that they are good at."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do they construct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know, arms, armor. You see, fire giants, they find their sense of self-worth in "society by their craftsmanship. So it's a very important thing for some."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Yeah. So, like, wheels? Or like weapons? Arms? You said arms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I said arms."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a hard time listening when you talk like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you like me to speak slower?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It might help, you know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! That's all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. That's just fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. Are you to funnel questions, or do you wish to ask as a troupe?"

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Funnel them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then decide on your questions now, or covertly speak once we enter. But we cannot stay "here in the open and continue to talk long."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three questions, quick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Has he heard of the Dawnmartyr?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're looking for a suit of armor he may have won in a card game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Looking--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And maybe he didn't win it, but has he seen it, heard of it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. Has he seen a suit of armor--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: --that vanished during a card game?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Question two. Does he know where it may be?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It has great emotional value.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And question three, if he doesn't want to tell us where, is there someone that he has an errand that he need run in exchange for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we mention the Suutan bloodline or do you think that would be bad blood? Is that bad?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Hey maybe now we've got--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) --bad blood!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. Does Senokir think that that would be bad?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it a bad idea to mention the Suutan bloodline?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know." (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry, you just seem to know so much about this fine city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know enough. But I don't know of the bloodline specifically. I've heard of it. You can "certainly inquire within. That's why we're here!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's three! Has he heard of them, does he know where it is and if he won't tell us, does he need an errand run, and Suutan bloodline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Senokir, where are you from originally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "These questions aren't pertinent at the moment."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. I was just curious; you're so interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. Now, shall we?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, let's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gives a tug on the chain, leads you guys inside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dark black leather apron across the torso, currently holding with heavy tongs this large, superheated piece of metal. Red sparks fly and illuminate the room with one hit. The second splash of light, as you see this piece of metal being slowly rotated from side to side. It's beaten into a heavier shape, the dark metal having a bladed edge to it, the actual length of it probably twice the size of Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the guesstimate on this fella's height?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say in the neighborhood of 20 feet. 16 to 20 feet from this vantage point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess he's the size of the zombie giants we fought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hammering) "So? Go."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want me to talk first? Yeah, no, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you're the one who wants to ask questions."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I got this.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Don't fuck it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm hanging back behind Percy here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does this guy have a name, Senokir?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whaska.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Strong Whaska.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The last hit strikes the blade before the hammer pulls back. The currently hunched and focused fire giant suddenly pulls back, and is standing. You see the glowing iron metal off the side, gently gliding across the ground and scraping the stone before it comes to rest at the side. The giant stands at its full height. You can see the heavily red bearded chin of itself gently singed on the edges. The dark gray ash-like skin of the face looks down at you, the eyes glowing with piercing red dots through the shadow. "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. I was curious if I could ask you a few questions and just take a moment of your time, which I'm sure is very valuable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The metal blade lifts and smacks the ground with a resounding (ting) sound that rings. All the other individuals working at the forges stop their work and look up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We promise we can make it worth your time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You may ask your questions."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are in search of a piece of armor, something that holds great weight and many legends behind it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then I have probably made it." (chuckles)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you have. It is called the Plate of the Dawnmartyr. Are you familiar with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His eyes squint a bit. "I am not familiar with this. I did not make this armor you ask."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't believe it is from this realm, but it resides here. It was won by a fire giant, as yourself, in a game of cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A game of cards?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs and laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I may know who you would actually be seeking."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really? That would be phenomenal information.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This information that would lead you to this powerful, legendary, sought-after armor you "seek-- is it worth a lot to you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well look, you shouldn't compare it to you or the things you've made, right? I'm sure--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He crosses his arms. You hear the clatter of the metal bracers he has on cling against each other as his muscles tense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, it's very valuable for us to find it! Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then--" He begins to walk over to the side (footsteps) grabs something in the shadow and you hear this scraping sound (creak) of heavy wood being dragged across stone as he lifts up and slams in front of you a table. A little bit larger height than you, you can look just above it, but it's a relatively large table. (boom) "Then make your offer."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming you don't want me to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (coughs) Jewels.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. (quietly) Do we still have all those jewels?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ask Senokir what he means.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at Whaska and I say: Let me confer with my other masters. Hey, Senokir, what does he want? What do you think is fair here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, usually as a craftsman, they want something of their craft, perhaps."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Craft? They want something-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Or you could always ask."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Yeah. I'll ask. Whaska!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In speaking with my fellow masters, we want to make sure we give you something that is fair and desired. Is there anything that you might have on your wish list?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He reaches forwards and rummages through a small pouch that's affixed to the side of his belt. When I say a small pouch, small by his comparison, the pouch is about the size of you, Keyleth, and as his fingers dig around inside you hear the clanging of heavy metal and various other objects slamming into each other. As he pulls out some sort of strange, small cylinder, he lifts it to his eye and peers through it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, he's looking to see what we got!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scans through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For servants you all walk with many enchanted, powerful, and desirable affixions to "yourselves."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are a very intelligent and observant man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puts away the cylinder into the pouch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Giant, fire, respected fire giant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And should it be worth the information you seek, "it will be yours."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me once again confer with my masters and enchanted servants. Okay, guys, what have we got?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a Ring of Lightning Resistance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you have a lot of fucking weapons in your Bag of Holding?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're just

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not bad. Greatsword of Frenzy!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whatever. And you said, a ring?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a Ring of Lightning Resistance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! My war mask! My war helmet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not magical, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You built that thing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, the helmet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's crafted, though. It's like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's so

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but it's hideous. And they said they didn't do it very well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's inscripted. It's got my title on the inside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got my magic choker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That won't even fit his thumb!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would put it on Pinterest. Maybe we could tell him it's a thimble. We could tell him it's a handcrafted thimble.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How high up is that side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about eight feet up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't fucking-- don't even.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, that's pretty tall, that's pretty high.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not pickpocketing a giant without some high rolls. Mind you, you can certainly try. I would

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got to feed those forges with something!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I have a Ring of Protection +1 that no one's been using because it's just a Ring of Protection +1. Which is good, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I have the Ring of Lightning Resistance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have two Vestiges.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to try this Greatsword of Frenzy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's do the Greatsword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the Alchemy Jug?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No way!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which we have used-- what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't matter, it's too cool! You make mayonnaise out of that all the time!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I have my +1 magic necklace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you using that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the heavy foot taps of an impatient--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, all right. Here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to take the Greatsword and the Ring of Lightning Resistance and put it on the table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can someone run that to me real fast, if you don't mind?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Coming!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (hums "Yakety Sax")

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm glad we didn't sell any of this stuff over the course of time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take the big Greatsword and (crash) put it on there, and take the ring, place it up there with it. Both of his large, meaty fire giant hands grasp the side of the table as he leans down and looks them over very intently. Takes the blade, holds it in his hands. "This is a very good start."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Well, lucky you! I also happen to have this awesome Magic Choker +1.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Choker? Did you offer the fire giant a fucking choker?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He can wear it as a pinkie ring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also offered him a tiny ring. He's going to use it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be like a little eyebrow piercing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you place it there, he glances at it for a second. The little, burning pupils of the giant look up towards you. "It was a strong start. Not a very strong follow up." As he leans back up, he says--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait! That's a two-for-one deal, because it also comes with this Ring of Protection. You just hadn't let me get that far yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Arms, arms!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't want jewelry, he wants arms!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, he wants arms, right. It's a Ring of Protection. That's cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but it's not weapons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems unmoved by the presentation of the ring. He says, "You are to make one more offer. If "you do not, I will tell the Illuminated of the dubious outsiders masquerading as servants. Slaves "sent to undermine the rule of the The Grand Sultan of the Efreet, The Lord of the Flame, The "Potentate Incandescent, The Tempering and Eternal Flame of Truth, The Most Puissant of Hunters, "Marshall of the Order of the Fiery Heart, The Smoldering Dictator, The Crimson Firebrand Marrake "al-Sidaan al-Hariq ben Lazan."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: God bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. What is your final offer?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was that

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax, give him all of your Vestiges! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we give him some of the dragon scales?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the black sapphire?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, we do have dragon scales. We do have a fuck-ton of dragon scales.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But he wants arms!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about some (whispers) dragon scales? Dragonhide? White dragon, what kind of dragonhide? White dragonhide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One large hard raises up, and begins to tug at the edge of his beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot of white dragonhide. I think we even have a fair amount.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just let it go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Make your offer."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get it out of the bag of holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His finger taps the edge of the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put it on the table, people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give him, like, 40 pounds of white dragonhide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he needs a lot. He's gonna have a big loincloth. A really big loincloth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's going to be weird.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 40 pounds of white dragonhide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? Can we do it like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You go ahead and unveil and put 40 pounds of white dragonhide--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to make sure it's like, "One, two, three, four, five--" Five minutes later, "37--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it's better if it's one big piece, as opposed to a bunch of tiny little pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pull all of the hide out. With flourish. As you finish, Whaska's mouth turns into this wide grin, as his arms go out (thump) scoop it all to his end of the table. "Your respect will "be remembered." He takes the handfuls of it, and the sword, puts the rings into the pouch, takes the sword and jams it into his belt, takes the hide, and walks over to the side and opens this large chest. Throws everything into the side of it. Closes it. And begins to walk over. As he walks away from it you hear this heavy metal click when he's about 15, 20 feet from the chest. He steps to the table. "Now--" He then rests his elbows on the table, folding his hands under his chin, leaning forward towards you, and looks over the rest of the troupe. "There are two other fire "giants here. One is Sugan. Sugan, well, was the brains behind our positions. I have this foundry "and this forge because Sugan led us against our people. He currently enslaved most of our kin, "with my help, and with the help of Juuraiel, and her late husband, Guras. Sugan, he currently "resides within the foundry itself, as a respected chain lord to the rest of his kind. Do not speak "to Sugan. You seek Juuraiel. Juuraiel runs a powerful slag mine in the pits. Her home is "outside the Shrine to Surtr, called the Smoking Hammer Shrine. Look for the spiraling tower of "black iron and copper. If there is any problems--" And he reaches back, and pulls forward a small, square, metal icon. And he flicks it over towards you. It looks like a small piece of copper in his thumb. But as he flicks it in your direction, you reach out instinctively to grab it, Keyleth, and then realize, "Oh, shit!" And you have to back out of the way as it (loud thud). Roughly the size of a manhole cover.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a ring?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This will grant you respect and conversation with "Juuraiel. Should she show any resistance, just tell her I gave it to you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. I go over and I start trying to (grunts) pick it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Use your legs. Bend the knees.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, no!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull a hammie?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get it a few inches off the ground--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or just a check, right? Just a straight check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, just with your modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, then five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get it a few inches off the ground before it (crashing sound) hits the ground with a resounding clang.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (hisses in pain)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost got your finger, but you're fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want me to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: C'mon, Beast Mode!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so strong, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll give it a try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: C'mon, Pike! Lift that thing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, definitely not. Just doesn't even move. That's a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between the two of you, given about five minutes, you guys could eventually carry it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You wouldn't happen to have a wallet version, would you? Don't worry about it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we put it in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabs the table and moves it back to the space he got it. (thunderous claps) "Our business "is done. Good luck. And should you find yourself in any trouble, you never heard my name." Turns back to the anvil, slowly puts on the apron, and goes right back to work. (metal ringing) Holds the metal over into the large furnace to the side to let it glow to a brighter orange, to white at the tip, and begins hammering once more. As you guys gather the rest of your strength to pull that along with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sexiest fire giant I ever did see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's touched. Just don't worry about her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Whaska! Is it okay if I ask one last question?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Depends on the question. What do you ask?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're not going to fist-bump, or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (metal ringing) Goes right back to hammering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you heard of the Plate of the Dawnmartyr?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it too late to roll an insight check to make sure he was telling us the whole story?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could roll one now to gain his current composure while he's hammering the large sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty good. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems focused on his work and cares less about your presence now than he did when you entered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How heavy is that thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, it's more cumbersome? It's awkward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't have handles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very wide. I can't really--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like picking up a box.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. But it's not that heavy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys are doing a great job with that, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a piece of pre-packaged Ikea furniture.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How is it they didn't design this to fit into a

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Keyleth and Pike carry it along at an angle because of height difference.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Got to take a second to switch hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait, wait, oh oh oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You walk backwards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We bought the new bed frame. It's called the "Nupe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No you go first, you go first.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go backwards, I'll go backwards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Turn it over!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you okay going down the stairs? Okay, okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (clanging sound effects)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As we leave, I give the saddest puppy stare to that wallet on the side of his belt and wish upon a star. And then I leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys make your way out into the main thoroughfare. Senokir turns back. "Very "well. I know where this shrine is, so follow me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (imitates Senokir) Great. We will.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (imitates Senokir) Great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) Weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you mocking me?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? What are you talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Continue, please." Pulls the chains a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (choking noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An extended period of time to make it towards where the mines and the pits are for the next hour or so, walking through the streets. As you're heading in this northward direction, you pass by a series of intersections where a lot of these lava rivers merge and splinter off. You can see there are individuals that are taking elements of it and carrying off large metallic buckets. You also notice in the distance one very terrifying-looking structure. All the rest have this beautiful, grandiose design to them. There is one that looks like it is made of curved obsidian spikes, like a series of giant, clawed hands climbing up over themselves. It forms a bastion in the center of the city. This is on the outskirts of the furnace that you walked past or saw in the distance when you first left Senokir's establishment. Pressing beyond that, you notice that there is a heavy number of nasty-looking devilish entities that seem to be running patrol around the outside of that building. You get the essence that there's a heavy devil presence in the City of Brass. Devils of multiple kinds, you gather. Many you've never seen before. But they seem to be gathering around and have that same terrifying essence to them. You see some that are humanoid, but covered in long chains with hooks at the end, dragging on the ground behind them. You see some that are these nasty little impish looking creatures that leap from section to section and usually travel in packs. But they all have business; they carry small satchels at their side. They mingle with the rest of the efreet and the other denizens of the city unmolested, unbothered, unprovoked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wave at a couple. Quietly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From a distance, you're not getting too close. No one seems to pay mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Senokir, what is that place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is the embassy. We shouldn't go by there."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why? What's in the embassy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that's where the ambassadors to the Nine Hells reside."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Nine. That's a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it like a cityscape?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have diplomatic immunity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Senokir, did that exchange go about the way you thought it would?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This guy likes to party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rough around the edges, like it's been pushed together, similar to the shrine you saw. But it's this spiral that continues upward. This very thick spiral that quickly tapers off into a point. You see there are levels to it, and there appear to be openings and windows. This is an abode of some kind. A very massive abode, and to a certain extent one of the more impressive buildings you've seen in this immediate vicinity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Big enough for a giant to live in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see a brass knob in the center of it, that is roughly about eye-height to you, Grog. And that's the extent of it. As you approach, Senokir turns around, "So I believe we've found our way to "the home of Juuraiel, as you acquired the information about. Your turn."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we know. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So? What is your intent here?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, gang. I don't feel like we should say the name of the thing that we want, in case she doesn't know what it is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe describe it? I feel like the more we make it seem like it's valuable to us, the more they're going to ask in return. So maybe make it seem less valuable?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She won it in a card game and hung it on the wall as a decoration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She could think it's a fucking trinket. It could be like nothing. It could be like a candlestick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I know if giants have any natural enemies that they hate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You only really know about stone giants in the Cliffkeep. And maybe hill giants. There is no specific, sworn, vengeful enemies to the stone giants that you're aware of.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he say that Sugan, being the brains of the two, enslaved other giants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got the essence that there was a large coup. There was a larger free citizenship of fire giants that existed within the city. Through some circumstance, these three currently remaining giants sold the rest of their kind within the city into slavery or had them ousted. The three that did so elevated their social status and became more powerful figures within the City of Brass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you might have to play him in a game of cards.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, Keyleth will?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I will not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a Scanlan or a Percy thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) You're a hustler, baby!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're not going to see me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you have the magic still, we could find out precisely where the armor is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. That spell lasts for ten minutes, the Locate Item spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'd have to cast it again. I only have one more level two spell because I don't have very many spells.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can cast it, because I shouldn't speak here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You did so good, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fair fire giant! Fair? Hammering at an anvil. 20 feet tall. Oh, fair, gentle fire giant!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, giant. My fair giant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we do the spell when we get up there, or now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it now, because it's 1,000 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll cast Locate Item.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you go and pull up your component, you snap a twig.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one's around and going to maim me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you finish, you feel the immediate glowing beacon of your intent within that structure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it on the ground floor? Or does it feel like it's above us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be maybe 25 feet up from where you currently are at an angle, on the inside of the building.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's going to be right on the inside, hanging on the wall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't Vax do some Spider-Man shit and check out the windows? He's all invisible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's risky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll just hear it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! And then you pretend like you tripped!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there really high windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are no windows on the bottom floor. On the second floor up, there are, yes. Which is about 40 feet up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's definitely on the first floor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're 20 feet high, so, high up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what it is. It's on the first floor, up high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So let me go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, dude! This is what you do!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He just said there were windows on the second floor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm already climbing. Would this be acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For climbing, this would be athletics.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Athletics. Dang it, Bobby. That's a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's simple. You see two beds in there, but the beds are 30 feet long, 20 feet wide with various hides and furs that have been patched together in this quilt-like fashion, but haphazard in their stitching. Other than that, it's not very pretty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think there might be a lot of giants potentially in here at any one time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see two very large metallic pissing pots that currently reside at the edge of each bed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eww, you could take a swim in it! (disgusted noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Were you so inclined, you definitely could.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But nobody in here now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nobody in here now, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any other windows along from where I am? I know they would be a ways off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a ways off to the next one, but you could try to climb over if you'd like to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make another athletics check for me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You slowly shimmy over. While the rest of you guys are waiting, as you're sitting there, you can't see what's happening; you occasionally see a pebble (thunk) and a bit of dust fall. Senokir's like, "Well, how about we walk around for a moment, so we aren't looking weirdly in public doing "nothing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're right. If you think we're looking weird, we should trust that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well said." Tugs the chain, and you guys begin to be dragged in a heavy circle around the nearby street.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I radio over the earpiece to Vax and say, hey, we're going to walk the block.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah cool, I'm just hanging.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You leap over, grasping, lose your hand for a second, and get back up there. The soreness is starting to kick in; you're not used to this much physical activity of this type of strength, and it's kicking your ass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So fast, but so weak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So fast, but so weak. It's already hot here, and the beads of sweat are pouring down your face at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have little indoor fans, like I'm a baseball mascot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, basically. Thankfully you have fire resistance so you don't have to worry about the heat getting too much on you. It's more of the physical exertion that's getting you. You do eventually pull over to the next window. As you get to it, you pull up into the lip, and as you reach out to grab, your hand hits something. You look up, and you see that this particular opening has an imperfect, thick glass window or at least a glass surface that is currently blocking the entrance. This is actually a window that is closed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it transparent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Somewhat transparent, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's just cloudy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's somewhat opaque, because of the nature of its creation it wasn't perfect glass. It's about that thick, and the entire oval is about six feet high, and about four feet wide.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I check for traps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, oh good, 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. This window is trapped. As you glance around, you can see that it is. It is a window that has a slot on the side. The glass is wider than the window in a slot that's pulled up through chains that you gather would probably lift it from the inside, like a winch that would pull it open or closed. However, on the bottom, you can see along the edge. On the very bottom edge, you can see some sort of slight bit of material that doesn't match both the glass or the blackened iron structure of this building. It's a silver plate that rests where the glass sits down. As soon as it would move, a weight would shift, and something would happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looking at it, do I think I could disarm it from this side? Or is it something from the inside of the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would need to be something from the inside. Even if you were to attempt to do it from the inside, you would have to be at the base of the structure. From this side, it's too big for you to do anything, really.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, and I can't see shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which gives you a total of?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, perception? A total of 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you peer in and close your eye on the inside, you can see another bedroom similar to the one over there that you just passed by. But this one is exorbitant in its decor. You see beautiful deep red tapestries along each wall that are the full length of it. The bed itself is a canopy bed that is 40 feet tall with heavy dark silks and fabrics that dangle from it. This is a gaudy bedroom for some sort of a giant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any armor on the walls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But nothing that resembles armor, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, my arms are starting to do this thing so I'm going to start going down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a giant velvet Elvis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually make your way down and wait for the rest of your group to return. You guys had a nice awkward walk being led quietly through the street and back around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we be the monks from Monty Python?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pie Iesu Domine. Dona Eis Requiem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin chanting to yourselves, Senokir goes, "Actually... sure, go ahead," and keeps pulling you along as you guys chant in whatever phrases you decide upon. You come back around and you see the rest of them arriving at the door, although they cannot see you. Senokir does glance over in your direction. "Ah, it appears that our walk was just enough time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, you can see him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have my ways, yes."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What kind of ways?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your brother is a fun character."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You mean a dick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From your standards, yes. Being from where I'm standing, I find it hilarious." (clipped laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god, his laugh's the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now shall we?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't even know how this door works. What if it's like a DeLorean and flips up or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know how to open this door?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we just knock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, let's try. I have not been here." Just knocks on it. It barely makes a noise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sounds like bubbles popping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like the knuckle against the stonework; it's making this dull, awful sound. Nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I knock? Do you want me to

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Knock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The big one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Can I lean back and slug the door using siege?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No weapon bonus though, just your strength.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, so that's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So that's your strength bonus and your proficiency modifier?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not my proficiency modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that would be 20. You reach back (heavy impact) and you watch as his hand hits the section where the engraved metal door is, dents inward, and leaves this big heavy dent in the front and the impact is like a dull thunderous clap of lightning. You hear it echo on the inside.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's engraved with something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was some very faint texture or pattern to it. Yeah, a design that was built into it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Knuckles. By the way, can I see that manhole cover you guys have been carrying around this whole time?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's got Giant runes on it. Runes of Giant.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Help me. Hey, Pike, can you help prop it up on that side?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I recognize any of these runes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You recognize it's Giant. You cannot read.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. This is very important script. It says that you must carry this at all times, and if you let it go prematurely you will die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't think he's telling the truth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Better safe than sorry, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, make a deception check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll hold it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What! Bullshit! Goddamn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is a grand total of?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a grand total of 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, Pike, I need you guys to both roll insight checks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the first time that actual Travis has really leaked into Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural one!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The stars are aligning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Suddenly, as Grog says this, you realize, him being of giant kin and the seriousness in his eyes, and the stark intensity in the way he describes this: If you drop this, something terrible is going to happen!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, I need to readjust my grip! Here, I want to put it on my back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grog, maybe you should hold it then because we're not as strong as you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I don't want to drop it. Will it kill all of us? Is it a blast radius thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The fable goes on to say that if you hand it to one of your friends, you will shit everywhere. Immediate bowel loss. Green apple splatters all over your feet, just awful.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That doesn't sound true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The giant tales are to be respected.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably don't believe the second half, but you do believe the first half.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is a fable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it could be metaphor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Safe than sorry, we'll just hold it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's at this point you hear this (thunk) and you hear this heavy, low (clicking) as the sound of chains being tightened and winding forward are followed by the large doorway rising up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it lifts!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it get stuck with the dent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as it rises, and there is a small carved slit where the knob itself rises up and fits as the door entirely lifts into the structure leaving the front walkway open and there standing, you see with arms off to the side apparently finishing the rotation of this chain--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A wench.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you see two male fire giants, fully armored with large blocky black metal swords staring down at you from each side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are they wearing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are both wearing dark plated scale mail, and both of them have these black bands of metal across their neck that have a small, pulsing red gem in the center.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But Matthew, are they fuckable, though? Those guards? Would you do them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've done some freaky shit in your time. Although in this circumstance you'd be the gerbil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm the gerbil.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lemmiwinks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are Lemmiwinks in this. If you want to gain some experience, that's up to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And really interesting fanart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway. They both stand there expectantly, saying nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this where we let the master do the talking?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're here to speak with Juuraiel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a small pause. You hear a voice echo from further back in the room, though you see no source for it, "What is your business with this Juuraiel?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have a deal we'd like to make. We have a token of our-- We want to play cards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh Jesus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you talking? Persuasion check?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the only one not in chains! I'm the only one who can! It's bullshit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could have made any of us look like not--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Persuasion? 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a pause and you hear a few heavy footfalls, getting louder as they go. Emerging from around the side, you see now a tall, broad-shouldered, female fire giant with a very strong square jaw. Her hair is pulled into this long red braid that dangles past her lower back and you can see it drifting behind her with this large metal ring that it's braided into at the bottom. She's not wearing any armor at the moment, just wearing casual clothes, and these clothes are lined with gold and platinum. This is a very expensive ware that she has on, as well as rings that encrust both of her hands. As she steps forward and looks out towards you. "So you want to "play cards and make a deal you say?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I lift with Pike the big manhole cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches over and grabs it, from both of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The fables were a lie!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She glances over it, and puts it over in her hands. "So, you have spoken with Whaska?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's hear your deal. Let them in!" She turns around and walks across to the end of the room, as the two giants step to the side, removing their crossed swords from the entryway that scrape across the stone. And you may enter the premises.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to look around immediately, all the walls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys walk in this central chamber, the foyer, if you will, it's beautiful. The use of autumn colors mixed with various golds and metallics to create this archway that is a band of brass, a band of gold, a band of platinum, a band of brass, and repeats itself onward. It has this tunnel-like feel, and within each of these walls, there are a number of weapons. Large, giant-sized weapons that are bolted into the wall and have beautiful runes inscribed within, and wooden plaques on the bottom that contain language that only you recognize, but can't read. There are shelves that contain large books that are locked up behind glass and chains roped across it. This is a collection. This is like a small personal museum. To your size, it is huge. To Juuraiel's size, it's like a nice den.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any pieces of armor with a sun on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Juuraiel raises her finger and says, "Could you please bring a means of my guests to speak eye "to eye?" And the two giants diverge slightly, both grab two of the chairs and scoot them in, up to the edge of the desk. These chairs are about head height to both of you at the resting point, so you'll have to climb up into them, and then probably get to be up at the desk level.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The cards are going to be like giant novelty cards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask a question? In my bag, I have two vials of fox's cunning. Is that a potion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I drink one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's so hot outside! I'm so thirsty! I would like just a sip. I had it made because I'm an idiot. Just in case the sewer plate says "eat these and enjoy" or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. She already took it, though. I'm looking at the walls at around 20 to 25 feet. Do I see it, up high on the ceiling? Because I've been looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has this uneven, flickering, frozen in time of the construct of the top of the shield. On the other side of her other shoulder, you see, much smaller in size, but a beautiful set of-- make sure I get the description right on this-- beautiful brass armor with priceless cut rubies all across the rest of the silver inlay of the armor itself.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: "But of course. You've already presented trust from one of my allies. You are safe within here."

lines.text: "Not to worry. Uten, if you don't mind." Uten pulls out the ring of keys that he has and goes through and begins undoing your guys' shackles. This will take a little while.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: "Even smaller!" And now leans in real close to the edge of the desk. The massive size of her face and the breath; it's delightful. It's a combination of rotting vegetation and very dry earth. But her teeth are gleaming. The smile is interested in whatever you're about to say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi there. I'm a bit of a gambler. I'm known around the worlds as being one of the luckiest men with a deck of cards you've ever met. I've won games in many of the different planes. I see that you collect many treasures that you've won in matches as well. Is that true?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eyes shift back and forth over the rest of you here, "I have an interest in games of chance "on occasion, yes. So, you come all this way to play games?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I have. I spend my life just playing games. It's my livelihood. I've won many things over the years. In fact, all of these great people, large and small next to me, I won in various card games around the planes. That one over there, the big one, I won him in a game of Gin Rummy in the Feywild. This guy I picked up in a game of Fish. I'm here to collect, possibly, one of your items, if that's all right with you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

She looks over, her red pupils slowly inspecting you. The grin grows even wider as she leans back, "Well, "you intrigue me, small one. If your luck has been so great as to collect these fine specimens of "strangers and you bring them all with you to such a place. Where do you hail from, if I might ask?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Places. That information is not relevant right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: (dry heaves)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You

Takes a couple cards for herself. Sets the deck aside, right in front of her. The two guards in the back, by the way, we hear them stepping away and retrieve their weapons, and head back behind you guys. Just keeping them at their sides.

How about, as your "friends are the ante on the table, throw yourself in as well?"
